info.game_comments: Battle of the Decades: The 1980s game 5.

(1, 1).clue: Constantly holding up the sky has torn this titan's rotator cuff; sorry, big guy, you need surgery

(2, 1).clue: It's stock symbol is AXP; don't leave home without it

(3, 1).clue: Cape Kumukahi southeast of Hilo is the easternmost point of this island group

(4, 1).clue: Before becoming Secretary of State in 1997, she was U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations

(6, 1).clue: She was the spurned Alex in "Fatal Attraction"

(1, 2).clue: In love with his reflection, this son of Liriope has the personality disorder named for him

(2, 2).clue: With the symbol KO, this beverage company is a real knockout

(3, 2).clue: New Hanover is part of this archipelago NE of New Guinea named for a German who never went there

(4, 2).clue: The co-founders of Google are Larry Page & him

(6, 2).clue: A role in this film brought Haing Ngor an Oscar

(1, 3).clue: This ferryman of the dead has forearm compartment syndrome, a result of his "death grip" on the oar

(2, 3).clue: This verb is the 3-letter stock symbol for Sotheby's

(3, 3).clue: The only tea plantation in Europe is found in this Portuguese island group in the Atlantic

(4, 3).clue: She was still being detained by her government when she won the Nobel Peace Prize

(5, 3).clue: To jostle & push, or a 1975 No. 1 disco hit by Van McCoy

(6, 3).clue: This rap group entered the medical field in "Disorderlies"

(1, 4).clue: This king of Corinth says it's his punishment to keep rolling the same boulder up a hill, but it sounds more like OCD

(2, 4).clue: The initials of the founder, JWN is the symbol for this high-end department store chain

(3, 4).clue: Chile maintains a Naval base on Navarino Island in this archipelago

(4, 4).clue: This Palm Beach socialite-turned-designer known for her tropical-print shift dresses died in 2013

(5, 4).clue: This weed has prickly leaves & a silky down attached to the seed-like fruit

(1, 5).clue: Electra has unresolved Daddy issues about him; is it guilt because he sacrificed her sister Iphigenia?

(2, 5).clue: In December 2013 shares of this company with more than 5,000 stores, symbol AZO, were driven up to around $500

(3, 5).clue: About 3/4 of the population of this archipelago lives on the main island of Rarotonga

(4, 5).clue: In 1987 Alan Greenspan succeeded him as head of the Fed

(5, 5).clue: "White Christmas" has 3 silent "T" words:Christmas, listen & this verb that follows "the treetops"

(1, 1).clue: This novel by Arthur C. Clarke is subtitled "Odyssey Two"

(2, 1).clue: The first shell around a nucleus can have a maximum of this many electrons

(3, 1).clue: John V. Bouvier, a Southhampton, New York stockbroker

(4, 1).clue: A direct popular vote, usually on a single issue

(5, 1).clue: In 2011 this U.N. organization, FAO for short, declared the first eradication of an animal disease, rinderpest

(6, 1).clue: The Bionic Man & the newly famous Jimmy Carter turn up in Alan Jackson's song about this year

(1, 2).clue: This auto executive wrote the bestselling hardcover nonfiction book of 1984 & 1985

(2, 2).clue: It's the term for the minimum amount of fissile material needed to achieve a self-sustaining chain reaction

(3, 2).clue: Marvin Pierce, a Rye, New York magazine publisher

(4, 2).clue: In a 1941 film, this circus performer is forced to join a clown act

(5, 2).clue: Answering its own musical question "Should I Stay Or Should I Go?", in 1986 this group went

(6, 2).clue: Type of title object in the songs "Ol' '55" & "Sweet Little '66"

(1, 3).clue: Drug-fueled debauchery in New York City takes up much of this Jay McInerney debut novel

(2, 3).clue: This massless subatomic particle sounds like an adhesive; it binds elementary particles together

(4, 3).clue: The World Trade Organization has an anti-this agreement

(5, 3).clue: Richard LaMotta created this treat of vanilla ice cream between 2 cookies; Nestle bought the brand & phased it out

(6, 3).clue: "I got my first real six-string / Bought it at the five & dime", begins this reminiscing song by Bryan Adams

(1, 4).clue: This New England title establishment is located in Derry; would you like turndown service?

(2, 4).clue: In the 1930s physicist Ernest Lawrence developed this first circular particle accelerator

(3, 4).clue: Frederick Dent, a Missouri planter & merchant

(4, 4).clue: AKA aluminum oxide, it's used as an abrasive

(5, 4).clue: This province made up the northeastern paart of South Africa until 1994

(6, 4).clue: It's the subtitle of Eurythmics' "Sexcrime" & the title of the movie soundtrack it's on

(1, 5).clue: This James Herriot book completes a series that began with "All Creatures Great & Small", & its title completes the rhyme
(1, 5).correct response: The Lord God Made Them All

(2, 5).clue: Meaning to neutralize a magnetic field, this term is derived from the name of a German scientist

(4, 5).clue: 3-word Latin phrase meaning to refute an argument by showing that its consequences are nonsensical

(5, 5).clue: This large flightless bird of New Zealand was hunted to extinction by the Maori in the 17th century

(6, 5).clue: "Justine never knew the rules, hung down with the freaks & ghouls" in this song by Smashing Pumpkins

(0, 0).clue: When these 2 men swapped jobs in 2012, their country's media described the move as "castling"
